items.title: India and Gulf Cooperation Council to ink fresh terms for FTA talks today

items.title: DLF sells Kolkata tech park, land to Srijan Group for ₹670 crore

This initiative follows the Finance Minister's announcement of a High Level Committee on Banking. The conclave will focus on customer-centricity and scaling credit. Banks will share roadmaps for the next five years.

items.title: India US trade deal: EAM Jaishankar, Marco Rubio welcome new pact; discuss energy, nuclear, defence, critical minerals

They discussed strengthening bilateral cooperation on critical minerals exploration and mining. The leaders also emphasized the importance of their democracies working together. Discussions covered trade, energy, defense, and technology.

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | Investors cheered the US trade reset but does this mark a long-awaited market turnaround?

items.title: Budget 2026 pulls right levers amid tailwind from US, EU trade pacts: Experts
items.summary: India’s latest Budget focuses on growth while maintaining fiscal discipline. Experts view it as a long-term roadmap for sustainable economic development rather than a short-term fix. The government has placed strong emphasis on strengthening manufacturing and services, while also reducing dependence on imports. Trade agreements with the US and the EU are expected to significantly boost exports and give domestic manufacturing a fresh push. Overall, the strategy aims to reinforce India’s global standing and promote more inclusive, broad-based growth across sectors.

items.title: No levy on US goods, but India's agriculture shielded: US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer
items.summary: India and the US are finalizing a trade deal that will see New Delhi eliminate tariffs on American industrial goods, including nuts, wine, and fruits. The US will also reduce tariffs on most Indian products. The agreement addresses technical trade barriers, aiming to open India's market to more US goods. India is also diversifying its energy imports away from Russia.

items.title: 'US tariff cut may lift GDP by 20-30 bps', say economists

Key sectors like gems and jewellery, textiles, and marine products will see improved exports. The rupee is also likely to stabilize with increased foreign investment.

items.title: US-India trade deal: How revised tariff will boost exports while shielding farms

Sensitive areas like agriculture and dairy remain protected. India is set to attract advanced technologies and integrate further into global value chains.

items.title: Seafood exporters hooking in US buyers after months of stalled orders

The textile, apparel, and seafood sectors are all experiencing renewed optimism. Exporters are planning trips and restarting production. This marks a significant turnaround for Indian trade with the US.

items.title: India likely to restrict duty-free imports of soybean, corn for human consumption under its US trade deal

The agreement may allow some American farm products for energy and animal feed. India is also considering market access for American sorghum and distillers-dried grains.  However, Indian consumers will likely see duty-free access for American nuts like almonds and walnuts.

items.title: Bernstein says India could benefit if US recession hits

Brokerage turned positive on India’s equity markets earlier this year after a cautious outlook in 2024, maintains that India’s macroeconomic recovery is already und

items.title: Bernstein stays cautious on India exposure, prefers low volatility, large-caps
items.summary: Investing.com -- Bernstein maintained a cautious stance on India exposure despite early signs of market inflection, advising against chasing small/mid-caps and high-volatility stocks. The firm reiterated its preference for large-cap and low-volatility stocks, which it views as the “cheapest” styles relative to the market and beneficiaries of strong earnings tailwinds.

items.title: Indian mutual funds need to focus on investor expectations, not just returns
items.summary: Investing.com -- Indian mutual funds should focus more on managing investor expectations rather than just chasing returns. Fund houses often overlook how retail investors react to market ups and downs, which affects long-term performance.
